> Thank you for your question, the current Filter sorting ability does have such a problem.
> To ensure compatibility, we do not consider removing either after-before or order for the time being. We can bind before-after and order together. For example, if before is configured, the value of order is reduced by 1, and after is added by 1.
> 
> According to your example, we can set the order value of F5 to -1
> 
> In best practice, we will also recommend order and after-before to configure only one, and finally use the order value to ensure the order of the Filter



> 是这样的，我们也是选择了order，放弃了befor/after

I have thought about binding before-after and order together，but maybe it will cause new problems. For example, I want one filter to execute between two other filter and they have the same order (many of the filter brought with the Dubbo Framework has not set the order, default to 0). Or in some more complex scenarios...

So, will you fix this problem? Do you have any plans?

For example, I want one filter to execute between two other filter and they have the same order (many of the filter brought with the Dubbo Framework has not set the order, default to 0). Or in some more complex scenarios...
> > So, will you fix this problem? Do you have any plans?
> 
> Can you give me a simple example if you want to make which two filters are in the same order?

Oh, maybe I had misunderstood you before. So you mean Dubbo developers don't need to care about order, only set filter order indirectly via before-after, and then sort by comparing their order (remove the part1 from the original comparator). What I think is like two filter F1 (order=n), F2 (order=n) and now I want to set F3 (before = F1, after=F2). According to before=F1, F3_order=n+1, according to after=F2, F3_order=n-1, their is a conflict apparently. of course you can handing the conflict by set F3_order=(F1_order+F2_order), then sort by comparing their class name (according to your solution to the previous problem #7757). 

> 建议加个开关 enableMixSort
> 默认 enableMixSort=false 只支持一种排序方式，如果发现两种，则抛出异常
> 然后 enableMixSort=true 则同时支持两种排序，控制台打印警告，该方案排序可能有问题


> > > Thank you for your question, the current Filter sorting ability does have such a problem.
> > > To ensure compatibility, we do not consider removing either after-before or order for the time being. We can bind before-after and order together. For example, if before is configured, the value of order is reduced by 1, and after is added by 1.
> > > According to your example, we can set the order value of F5 to -1
> > > In best practice, we will also recommend order and after-before to configure only one, and finally use the order value to ensure the order of the Filter
> > 
> > 
> > > 是这样的，我们也是选择了order，放弃了befor/after
> > 
> > 
> > I have thought about binding before-after and order together，but maybe it will cause new problems. For example, I want one filter to execute between two other filter and they have the same order (many of the filter brought with the Dubbo Framework has not set the order, default to 0). Or in some more complex scenarios...
> > So, will you fix this problem? Do you have any plans?
> 
> 我也没有更好的办法，我不理解当时设计before-after与order共同存在的意义，目前我们项目中仅使用order，并在项目readme中注释了filter执行顺序来帮助后续人员理解。

So the sort of filter in Dubbo framework is indeed unreasonable, both by binding the order or by setting the switch enableMixsort to forbidden the use of befor-after, The ultimate purpose is to compare the two filter with an unique indicators in the comparator, isn't it? So, after all, do you have a plan to modify your source code according one of the solution you given above? Or at least you should mark this bug in your developer usage documentation to suggest Dubbo developers not to config before-after, because many of peers do not know the problem at all I think. 
Finally I want to say is that comparing filter with the same order with the filter class name also creates a small problem, that maybe sometimes it need developers to violate mainstream java class naming habits when you do need to insert an filter between two existing filters with the same order, which will make developers feel hard sometimes, doesn't it? And in another hand, if a developer does not notice the class name comparison rule, it may still be problematic. But beyond that, there is really no particularly good way to compare it when the order is the same...How helpless it is~!

```xml
<beans xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
       xmlns:dubbo="http://dubbo.apache.org/schema/dubbo"

    ">

    <!-- current application configuration -->
    <dubbo:application name="demo-consumer"/>

    <!-- service configuration -->

</beans>
```

你好，我是 sca 这边的同学，你反馈的这个问题之前确实是存在的。
之前的逻辑，是为了提升效率，直接使用clone的方式来创建新的 URL。
在之前的实现中，认为同一个应用的同一个接口，除了ip和端口其他都应该是一致的。这就导致了你现在碰到的这个问题。

最新的实现，参照了 dubbo3 的 revision 机制，会对所有提供的服务计算一个版本号，不再单独使用应用名做分组。应该是能解决这个问题的。

最新的代码已经包含了这部分逻辑，正式版本最近会发布，目前你可以使用 2.2.6-bugfix5-SNAPSHOT 试一下。
期待你的答复。

@AlbumenJ 谢谢。
我目前的解决方案是：dubbo升级到2.7.12，curator升级到4.2.0，排除curator本身的zk版本，引用了自己的3.4.8的zk版本
![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/790395/123025959-fed57f00-d40d-11eb-80a2-d559095574e7.png)
另外，还发现一点：用过2.7.9的，在zookeeper目录下，找到/dubbo/config，下面有个mapping目录，这个在用2.7.12前要删除，否则会报错。
![图片](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/790395/123025294-fdf01d80-d40c-11eb-90cc-88d5885086bf.png)

问题1、2、3在不同dubbo版本下的测试：
1. dubbo2.7.5版本
无论是在启动类加@EnableDubbo注解，还是在application.yml配置dubbo.scan.basePackages都存在问题1、2、3；两种方式启动时间都是12秒左右。

2. dubbo2.7.12版本
启动类上加@EnableDubbo注解的方式，运行正常，问题1、2、3都没有了；只是改成这种方式之后启动测试程序耗时从18秒变成了80秒，也是醉了。
只在application.yml配置dubbo.scan.basePackages的方式还有问题1、2，而问题3没有了，启动耗时不到18秒。

补充：
```
启动慢的原因找到了，有1台nacos注册中心down了，up之后重新测试，两个dubbo版本每种方式各测试10次左右，情况如下。
dubbo2.7.5版本：两种方式下启动耗时均在5~7秒之间；
dubbo2.7.12版本：@EnableDubbo方式下启动耗时在9~12秒之间；application.yml配置dubbo.scan.basePackages方式下启动耗时在6~10秒之间。
```
